title: Will the Fed signal a rate cut pause and will the BoJ ease?
text: When the Federal Reserve convenes in Washington this week, chairman Jay Powell is widely expected to announce another quarter-point reduction to the central bank’s benchmark rate, the third such move in as many meetings. Should the Fed follow through, it will have eased monetary policy by a collective 75 basis points. Mr Powell used this exact terminology in July when he announced the first interest rate cut since the financial crisis a decade ago, framing the move as an insurance cut against future economic weakness.
